title: [caffe2] segmentation fault for running 'from caffe2.python import core'
body_html:
Issue description

I followed official instruction to install caffe2-cuda8.0-cudnn7 with conda. When I run from caffe2.python import core in Python, the console will output a segmentation fault error. Plus, even if I set up CUDA8, cudnn7 and build nccl from the source, caffe2 still cannot find the GPU. I also tried using symbolic link to link libnccl.so.2 to libnccl.so.1 or libnccl.so, but it still doesn't work. Could you give me some help?

Console output

WARNING:root:This caffe2 python run does not have GPU support. Will run in CPU only mode.
WARNING:root:Debug message: libnccl.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
Segmentation fault

## Issue description

I followed [official instruction](https://caffe2.ai/docs/getting-started.html?platform=ubuntu&configuration=prebuilt) to install caffe2-cuda8.0-cudnn7 with conda. When I run `from caffe2.python import core` in Python, the console will output a segmentation fault error. Plus, even if I set up CUDA8, cudnn7 and build nccl from the [source](https://github.com/NVIDIA/nccl), caffe2 still cannot find the GPU. I also tried using symbolic link to link libnccl.so.2 to libnccl.so.1 or libnccl.so, but it still doesn't work. Could you give me some help?

## Console output

> WARNING:root:This caffe2 python run does not have GPU support. Will run in CPU only mode.
WARNING:root:Debug message: libnccl.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
